titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Larkin (Slave of Jesse Yates), Indictment
CWG11410

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
State of Kentucky
Clark Circuit } Sct

Be it remembered that on the 15th day of May 1862 the Grand Jury impannelled and Sworn for the Circuit of Clark County returned into court an Indictment which read on the words and figures following towit.

"Clark Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
against
Larkin -- Slave of Jesse Yates

The Grand Jury of Clark County, in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, accuse Larkin, Slave of Jesse Yates of the crime of wounding White Person with Intent to Kill, Committed as follows, Viz The Said Larkin Slave of Jesse Yates on the 10th day of May 1862 in the County aforesaid Willfully and Maliciously wounded John Thomas a Free white Person by striking him on the Head and Arms with a stick with the intent to Kill said Thomas against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Endorsed on the back of said Indictment
"A True Bill
W C Sympson Foreman
I Aylett H Buckner clerk of the Clark Circuit Court do certify that the foregoing Indictment against Larkin a slave of Jesse Yates, is truly copied from the Original now on file in My office

Given under my hand this 28th day of May 1862
A H Buckner clk

Ohio
The Commonwealth of Ky
vs } Copy Indictment
Larkin -- Slave of Jesse Yates
Requisition for Larkin (a Slave) charged with Felony in the Clark Cir Ct
Issd May 28th 1862.
Jno W Thomas agent
